alert.note: Alert for Campbell (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 4:14AM CDT until July 21 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell and Scott. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Follette, Oneida, Jacksboro, Huntsville, Helenwood, Caryville, Rocky Top, Winfield, Norma, Smokey Junction, Royal Blue, Slick Rock, Elk Valley, Ketchen, Robbins, Cove Lake State Park, Elgin, Honey Creek State Park, Frozen Head State Park and Disney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
